Description: Dīnār weight. Five line Kufic inscription. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: Five dies are known of the dīnār denomination under ʿUbaydāllāh b. al-Ḥabḥāb, all easily distinguishable by differences in the legend or its disposition. Besides OA+ 4160, there are two dated types of AH 114 (Fahmī 1957, 9) and 115 (Miles 1948, 10a described on p. 79. Cf. Miles 1964, 4) and a fifth type represented by a single defective piece (Balog 1976, 68). On this last there would seem to be room on the missing lower part for a date. On the present piece, note the curious division of the word 'ilbn' between the second and third lines. Bibliography: Fahmi, A. 1957. ‘Sinaj al-sikka fī fajr al-Islām’. Cairo; Miles, G.C. 1948. ‘Early Arabic Weights and Stamps’. New York; Miles, G.C. 1964. Early Islamic weights and measures in the Muntaza Palace, Alexandria. ‘Journal of the American Research Centre in Egypt’ III. Cairo, Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (31)
